paper.title: Specifying Optimal Design of a Steam-Boiler System
paper.abstract: Mean Value Calculus is a real-time interval logic which can be used to specify and reason about timing and logical constraints of real-time systems. In this paper, we apply it to specify and verify the steam-boiler control problem for Dagstuhl seminar. In addition to specifying safety requirement, emphasis is put on capturing non-functional requirements which reflect the qualities of designs, such as performance and optimization. Especially the fault-tolerant optimal design is presented to make the system run as long as possible while the water sensor is broken down.
